definition: horse race/to ride a horse at a fast pace/wet dream
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
rushing to stake one's claim in new markets
Paoma Mountain in Kangding 康定[Kang1 ding4], Sichuan

sentences.english: This is a use of assembly language procedures for the preparation of the Marquee .
sentences.chinese: 這是一個利用匯編語言進行編寫的跑馬燈程序。

sentences.english: Then suddenly they vanished behind a great clump of trees growing in the middle of the Hippodrome .
sentences.chinese: 然後他們突然被跑馬場中間的一大片樹叢遮擋住了。

sentences.english: The horse paced around the ring.
sentences.chinese: 那匹馬在跑馬場的四周溜蹄。

sentences.english: Valley Veterinary Centre, G/F, 15 Yuen Yuen Street, Happy Valley, Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 快活谷獸醫中心，香港跑馬地源遠街15號地下。

sentences.english: For the moment he was working as actor and horse-rider with the circus.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，他在這家馬戲團當演員跑馬。

sentences.english: Western Anatolian dancers perform at the Hippodrome.
sentences.chinese: 古羅馬跑馬場裏來自安納托利亞高原西部的舞者。

sentences.english: This mound was also known as the "Horse-Riding Platform, " since Emperor Qianlong used to ride his horse here.
sentences.chinese: 此山曾是乾隆帝跑馬登山處，俗稱轉馬臺。

sentences.english: Before liberation, the area of Shanghai People's Square and the People's Park was a famous horse racetrack.
sentences.chinese: 今人民廣場和人民公園一帶在解放前是著名的跑馬廳。

sentences.english: He won a monkey at the horse races.
They arrived on the horse court at two.
sentences.chinese: 兩點鐘時他們抵達跑馬場。

sentences.english: She told him she had won the money on a horse .
sentences.chinese: 她對他說，那筆錢是她在跑馬場買彩票贏來的。

sentences.english: As I walk'd where the ripples continually wash you Paumanok.
sentences.chinese: 我不倦地行走去洗刷跑馬洛克的漣漪。

sentences.english: Mrs. Chambers wants to see the racing results. She won quite a lot of money last week.
sentences.chinese: 喬柏斯太太想看看跑馬比賽的結果。

sentences.english: Then we drove to Race court to have lunch.
sentences.chinese: 然後我們開車去了跑馬場喫午飯。

sentences.english: He looked up at the clock above the grandstand and saw that it was still only twenty minutes to ten.
sentences.chinese: 他看看西邊跑馬廳高樓上的大鐘，還只有九點四十分。

sentences.english: With one's hair flying back like the tail of a race-horse.
sentences.chinese: 頭髮飛揚，就像一匹賽馬會上跑馬的尾巴。

definition: to warm up (sports)/(fig.) to prepare/to get in condition
the end/end point/finishing line (in a race)/destination/terminus/CL:個|个[ge4]
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
wind direction/the way the wind blows/fig. trend/direction of events/how things develop (esp. how they affect oneself)/public opinion (concerning one's actions)/publicity (usually derog.)/limelight
to ride (a bicycle, horse, motorbike etc)/cycling/horseback riding/motorbike riding/a ride/CL:次[ci4]
magic transformation performed by Daoist immortal/fig. to reveal/to enlighten
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
